column4: does anyone know of a good *batch* mkv to avi converter similar to windows alltoavi?
linux users take a single commands and turn them into scripts
Microsoft users need special programs for many things that linux users normally create a simple script for.
Converting videos can be a challenge, it is true.
Lemme have a look at the manpage real quick. I'm pretty familiar with mplayer
What command did you use with mencoder?
This looks about right: mencoder -of avi -o file.avi file.mkv
thanks. im just looking for the script i have been using
Scripting is the easy part, I can do that for you. Do you have the code to convert 1 video from mkv to avi?
do u mean the code i have been using? im just looking for that now
found the ffmpeg command. it converts the video and audio fine but doesnt grab subtitles

-r 29.97 -vcodec libxvid -vtag XVID -s 320x240 -aspect 4:3 -maxrate 1800k -b 1500k -qmin 3 -qmax 5 -bufsize 4096 -mbd 2 -bf 2 -flags +4mv+trell -aic 2 -cmp 2 -subcmp 2 -g 300 -acodec libmp3lame -ar 48000 -ab 128k -ac 2
those are the options i have been using in conjunction with the preceding ffmpeg infile.mkv outfile.avi
I assume you tried the option "-scodec copy"?
To copy the subtitles?
yeah but from my understanding, scodec is asking for a subtitle file as opposed to grabbing a subtitle stream from the mkv
If the mkv has the subtitles in it, then they should be copied with the option "-scodec copy".
The -scodec argument takes a codec name, not a file.
do you think a subtitle stream can be specified in the case where there are multiple streams or the default is 0?
I would try your normal command, and just add "-scodec copy" into it.
